Class AnimatedImageView

  • java.lang.Object
    • AnimatedImageView

  • public class AnimatedImageView
extends java.lang.Object
    The AnimatedImageView Class This class stores an animation, by storing many frames of a picture. This is used in the WaterWorks program to show animations of the character moving on the spot.

    Course Information:

    ICS4U0 with Krasteva, V.

    Total Time Spent: 1.5 hours

    Version:
    6 06.09.2019 
     Version History:
 May 26:
 This class was written by copying the AnimatedImage class but returning ImageView objects from the getFrame() and lastFrame() objects. -- 0.5 hours
 May 29:
 Vansh redid the class to no longer store an array of ImageView objects, but to store a path location and a frame number. The instance methods and constructor were rewritten to accomodate for this change, and now do not return items using indexes of an array, but return items using the path location. -- 1 hour
    Author:
    Maria Yampolsky and Vansh Juneja

      private double duration
      The duration of the animation.
      private int numFrames
      The number of frames in the animation.
      private java.lang.String path
      The path location of the files in which the frames of the animation are stored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimatedImageView

        public AnimatedImageView(java.lang.String path,
                         int nframes,
                         double duratn)
        The constructor of the AnimatedImageView class, which creates an object of the class.
        Parameters:
        path - The path where the images used for the animation are located
        nframes - The number of frames in the animation
        duratn - The duration of the animation

    • Method Detail

      • frame

        public int frame(double time)
        The frame() method, which returns the frame number of an animation based off of the time entered.
        Parameters:
        time - The time into the animation, determines which frame the animation is on
        Returns:
        An integer that represents the frame number that the animation is currently on

      • getFrame

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getFrame(double time)
        The getFrame() method, which returns the frame of an animation based off of the time entered.
        Parameters:
        time - The time into the animation, determines which frame the animation is on
        Returns:
        An ImageView object that represents the frame that the animation is currently on
